recipeIngredient: 2  large Portobello mushrooms (or 3 medium, cleaned with a damp cloth)
2 tsp vegan Worcestershire sauce or use soy sauce ((tamari to make glutenfree))
1 tbsp white wine  (or use a tsp white wine vinegar or omit)
a generous dash of salt and pepper
1/4 cup raw cashews ( (soaked in hot water for 15 minutes if needed))
1 tbsp arrowroot starch or use flour
1 tbsp nutritional yeast (optional, if you like the gravy cheesier, use more)
chopped fresh basil and black pepper to taste for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: In a shallow dish, mix all the ingredients under marinade. Place the portobello mushrooms in the dish and brush the marinade all over, Let it marinade for 10 to 15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: In a shallow dish, mix all the ingredients under marinade. Place the portobello mushrooms in the dish and brush the marinade all over, Let it marinade for 10 to 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a grill or a heavy bottom pan over medium heat. Spray or brush oil on the pan. When hot, place the mushrooms on the pan, partially cover and cook for 3 to 4 minutes per side. If the the mushrooms are thin, they will cook through in the time. If they are thick, transfer to the oven and bake at 400 degrees F for 15 minutes or until a knife goes through easily. To Bake the marinated mushrooms without grill step, bake for 25 to 30 minutes in the shallow dish.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the sauce: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and pinch of salt and cook until translucent.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the sauce: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and pinch of salt and cook until translucent.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer half of the mixture to a blender. Add the rest of the ingredients and blend until smooth. Blend a couple of times of 1 minute cycles so the cashews blend in.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer half of the mixture to a blender. Add the rest of the ingredients and blend until smooth. Blend a couple of times of 1 minute cycles so the cashews blend in.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the blended mixture into the skillet with the remaining onion garlic and cook over medium heat until thickened. Taste and adjust salt and flavor. Add a dash of thyme and a tsp of vegan worcestershire or soy sauce for additional flavor if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the mushrooms drizzled generously with the creamy sauce, fresh basil (adds great flavor) and black pepper.
